intro: Fimbristylis inconstans, commonly known as the variable sedge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered flower heads. This species is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Pacific Islands. Fimbristylis inconstans typically grows in wetland habitats such as marshes, swamps, and along the edges of ponds. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems, contributing to soil stabilization and biodiversity.
